thing-type.label: DCH-Z120 Battery Motion Sensor
thing-type.description: Battery Motion Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe sensor DCH-Z120 has a PIR sensor integrated with temperature and illumination, which are 3 sensors function in one, based on Z-WaveTM technology.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtHave Z-WaveTM Controller entered inclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtPressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds to enter the inclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtAfter add successful, the device will wake to receive the setting command from Z-WaveTM Controller about 20 seconds.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtHave Z-WaveTM Controller entered exclusion mode.</li&gt <li&gtPressing tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds to enter the exclusion mode.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtRemove the front cover and press the tamper key once. The device will wake-up 10 seconds.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Basic Set Level
parameter.description: Setting the BASIC command value to turn on the light.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0: Turn off the light.</li&gt <li&gt1 - 100: For dimmers 1 to 100 means the light level.</li&gt <li&gt255: Turns on the light. (Default) </li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: PIR Sensitivity
parameter.description: Set the sensitivity for the PIR (Passive Infrared Sensor).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<ul&gt<li&gt0 = Disable the PIR motion detection.</li&gt <li&gt1 - 99 = 1 means the lowest sensitivity, 99 means the highest sensitivity</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtHigh sensitivity means can detected long distance, but if there is more noise signal in the environment, it will re-trigger too frequency. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Light Threshold
parameter.description: Set the illumination threshold to turn on the light.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtWhen the event triggers and the environment illumination is lower than the threshold, the device will turn on the light.</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt0 means turn off illumination detected function. And never turn on the light.</li&gt <li&gt1 means darkest. 99 means brightest.</li&gt <li&gt100 means turn off illumination detected function. And always turn on the light. </li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtNotice: In none test mode, only the value in 1 to 99 will enable the illumination detected function and update the illumination value. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Operation Mode
parameter.description: Parameter to set the Operation Mode.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit0: Reserve</p&gt <p&gtBit1: 1 means test mode, 0 means normal mode</p&gt <p&gtBit2: Disable the door/window function. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit3: Setting the temperature scale. 0: Fahrenheit, 1: Celsius</p&gt <p&gtBit4: Disable the illumination report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit5: Disable the temperature report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit6: Reserve</p&gt <p&gtBit7: Disable the back key release into test mode. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Multi-Sensor Function Switch
parameter.description: Parameter to set the sensor functions.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit0: Disable magnetic integrate illumination to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit1: Disable PIR integrate Illumination to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit2: Disable magnetic integrate PIR to turn ON the lighting nodes in the association group 2. (1:Disable, 0:Enable) (Default is Disable)</p&gt <p&gtBit3: When Bit2 is 0 (Enable), are the device and the lighting in the same room? 0: In the same room(Default), 1: In the different room. Notice: If this bit is 1, it is recommended also set the Bit1 to 1, cause the PIR triggered, doesn't mean the people in that room.</p&gt <p&gtBit4: Disable delay 5 seconds to turn off the light, when door/window closed. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit5: Disable auto turn off the light, after door/window opened to turn on the light. (1:Disable, 0:Enable) Notice: If bit2 is zero, this setting isuseless. Notice: If the configuration No.9 is zero, this setting is useless.</p&gt <p&gtBit6: Reserve.</p&gt <p&gtBit7: Reserve.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Customer Function
parameter.description: Parameter to set the Customer Function.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBit0: Reserve.</p&gt <p&gtBit1: Enable sending motion OFF report. (0:Disable, 1:Enable) Note: Depends on the Bit4, 0: Report Notification CC, Type: 0x07, Event: 0xFE 1: Sensor Binary Report, Type: 0x0C, Value: 0x00</p&gt <p&gtBit2: Enable PIR super sensitivity mode. (0:Disable, 1:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit3: Disable send out BASIC OFF after door closed. (1:Disable, 0:Enable) <strong&gtNOT USED WITH DCH-Z120</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtBit4: Notification Type, 0: Using Notification Report. 1: Using Sensor Binary Report.</p&gt <p&gtBit5: Disable Multi CC in auto report. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit6: Disable to report battery state when the device triggered. (1:Disable,0:Enable)</p&gt <p&gtBit7: Reserve.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000002
parameter.label: 7: Bit1: Enable sending motion OFF report.
parameter.description: 0:Disable, 1:Enable<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtNote: Depends on the Bit4, 0: Report Notification CC, Type: 0x07, Event: 0xFE 1: Sensor Binary Report, Type: 0x0C, Value: 0x00 </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000004
parameter.label: 7: Bit2: Enable PIR super sensitivity mode.

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000020
parameter.label: 7: Bit5: Disable Multi CC in auto report.

parameter.name: config_7_1_00000040
parameter.label: 7: Bit6: Report battery state when device triggered

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: PIR Re-Detect Interval Time
parameter.description: Set re-detect time after PIR motion triggered<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt8 seconds per tick, default tick is 3 (24 seconds).<br /&gtSetting the suitable value to prevent received the trigger signal too frequently. Also can save the battery energy.<br /&gtNotice: If this value bigger than the configuration setting NO. 9. There is a period after the light turned off and the PIR not start detecting. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Turn Off Light Time
parameter.description: Set delay time to turn off light after motion triggered.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAfter turn on the lighting, setting the delay time to turn off the lighting when the PIR motion is not detected.<br /&gt8 seconds per tick, default tick is 4 (32 seconds).<br /&gt0 means never send turn off light command. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Auto Report Battery Time
parameter.description: Interval time for auto reporting the battery level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the battery level.<br /&gt0 means turn off auto report battery. The default value is 12. The tick time can setting by the configuration No.20. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: Auto Report Illumination Time
parameter.description: Interval time for auto reporting the illumination.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the illumination.<br /&gt0 means turn off auto report illumination.<br /&gtThe default value is 12. The tick time can setting by the configuration No.20. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Auto Report Temperature Time
parameter.description: Interval time for auto reporting the temperature.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report the temperature.<br /&gt0 means turn off auto report temperature.<br /&gtThe default value is 12. The tick time can setting by the configuration No.20. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Auto Report Tick Interval
parameter.description: Interval time for auto reporting each tick.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe interval time for auto report each tick. Setting this configuration will effect configuration No.10, No.11, No.12 and No.13.<br /&gtCaution: Setting to 0 means turn off all auto report function </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Temperature Differential Report
parameter.description: The temperature differential to report.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe temperature differential to report.<br /&gt0 means turn off this function.<br /&gtThe unit is Fahrenheit.<br /&gtEnable this function the device will detect every minutes.<br /&gtAnd when the temperature is over 140 degree Fahrenheit, it will continue report.<br /&gtEnable this functionality will cause some issue please see the detail in the “Temperature Report” section. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_1
parameter.label: 22: Illumination Differential Report
parameter.description: The illumination differential to report.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe illumination differential to report.<br /&gt0 means turn off this function.<br /&gtThe unit is percentage.<br /&gtEnable this function the device will detect every minutes.<br /&gtEnable this functionality will cause<br /&gtsome issue please see the detail in the<br /&gt“Illumination Report” section </p&gt</p&gt
